did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: UNITE Local 23-25 Memorabilia, 1977-2004
did.origination: Union of Needletrades, Industrial and Textile Employees (UNITE); UNITE Local 23-25
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.langmaterial: Collection material in English, Spanish, and Chinese

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Union of Needletrades, Industrial, and Textile Employees
Union of Needletrades, Industrial, and Textile Employees. Local 23-25 (New York, N.Y.)

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: UNITE Local 23-25 Memorabilia #6000/024 MB. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Banner 3'11" x 5'8" White background with red lettering "Local 23-25, ILGWU" and also a large ILGWU Union Label emblem.

Banner 2'6" x 3'11" Navy blue background with white lettering "Blouse Skirt and Sportswear Workers' Union" ; yellow lettering "Local 23-25 ILGWU" ; white letter "International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union, AFL-CIO", with gold fringe along the bot
Banner 3'3" x 8'1" Red background with white lettering "ILGWU First Aid Team" and a large Union label emblem at one end of banner.
Banner 3'1" x 8'10" Red background with white lettering "UNITE! First Aid Team" ; at one end it has a large "First Union Health Center-ILGWU" emblem.
Banner 3'4" x 14'9" Navy blue background with white lettering "International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union" ; with a large Union label emblem at one end of banner.

Key chains 3 round gold pendants with the ILGWU emblem on the front, and "Local 23-25" ; 2 plastic rectangular pendants "New York City Youthline, [phone no.]" white background with yellow and blue print
Assorted buttons and pins push pins for "CLUW", "Hispanic Labor", AFL-CIO, and miscellaneous union buttons.
Buttons "International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union, Local 91" ; "NO NAFTA" ; "We are ONE in '91" ; "Labor Supports CUNY, Don't Cut Our Class" ; "ILGWU, UIOVD" ; "United We Stand"
Misc. buttons, mostly UNITE! "UNITE! For a fair contract (Chinese and Engl.) ; "Sweeney, Trumka, Chavez-Thompson, A New Voice For American Workers" ; "Remember Tienanmen"
Misc. buttons, and one badge all from UNITE!. "Doris Ling-Cohan for Civil Court" ; "Int. Ladies Garment Workers Union, Union Made 23-25, AFL-CIO" ; badge is "UNITE!, Delegate"

Misc. button and push-pin from "Women's Suffrage Whakatu Wahine" attached to a small folder with information. Two "Official Volunteer Organizer" cards one in English, one in Spanish. One plastic ruler from the ILGWU.
Glass plate White with gold trim and red lettering. "Chung Pak Community Center, Opening Ceremony, June 29, 1993, Sponsored by Citibank"
Screen prints for flags in box 7
Two paper hats White with "ILGWU" in red and a Union Label emblem

Included in the box is a wooden block that has been hand carved. On one side is a ILGWU Union Label Emblem, on the other is written "To Vice President Jay Mazur, Good Luck, Ben Laboda, Local 99, June 3, 1977"
Also included is a roll of 'Union Labels" used in clothing.
Oversize box with a sign, posters, award, original artwork, and plaque.
Sign 34 cm. x 46 cm. Gray with black lettering in Chinese and English. "Local 23-25 ILGWU, Political Department, Research/Education Department"

Original artwork 31 cm. x 41 cm. By Jolanta Pienczykowski, and includes a note about the Artist's background (copy in accession file). "The Faces Behind The Union Label" is the title of the piece, it's a picture of a clothes hanger with a coat hangin
Poster Chinese and English 28 cm. x 43 cm. "Mass Rally, Defend the Garment Industry."
"Three Founders Award" 33 cm. x 39 cm. Certificate awarded to Shelley Appleton, Vice President of ILGWU, April 5, 1975, from Manhattan 28, American Veterans Committee.
Plaque 36 cm. x 50 cm. "Local 23-25 NEWS" issue displayed on a plaque. Headlines for this issue are "Local Shows Strength in Labor Parade", Oct. 1981 issue.

Poster 46 cm. x 58 cm. "Freedom House" ; this is a poster with a picture from Tienanmen Square, Beijing and a letter from max M. Kampelman (Chairman, Freedom House) to President George Bush about Human Rights violations.

Poster 44 cm. x 56 cm. "The CALL" Headlines read "Shirtwaist Strikers Present Facts of Great Struggle to the Public of New York City", in bottom left corner "Extra! Reissued by ILR Press" ; "Literature of American Labor Series, Diary of a Shirtwai
Poster 44 cm. x 56 cm. "Local 23-25 ILGWU" Christmas New Years Celebration (1990) on orange paper and signed by members at the gathering. 4 copies
Poster 48 cm. x 60 cm. Hand made "Garment Industry Day Car Center of C.P.C." letters are silver and green, and it has little animals on it for decoration.
Poster 46 cm. x 60 cm. Black lettering in Chinese. Red and white "UNITE" emblem on the bottom.
Poster 56 cm. x 71 cm. Hand made by children. Colored and written with crayons, "The Wizard of OZ On Ice" a thank you note to Mrs. May Ying Chen from "you friends at GIDCC"
Calendar 46 cm. x 60 cm. 1993 "There was an old woman who lived in a shoeshe was a member of the ILGWU". The picture on the front is of children popping out of a shoe.
Scarf Made out of ILGWU Union Label material.
Flag triangle in shape Yellow "CLUW, Chinese Committee"
Flag triangle in shape Orange (two sided) "Enforce Labor Laws UNITE!" on one side, the other side is in Chinese
Name plate for May Chen (gold with black lettering) 3"x10"
Hang tags, letter -- Letter about the hang tags, and 9 hang tags -- red with blue lettering, blue with white stripes on one end -- "UNITE! Proudly made in New York" -- [10 tags] 2001
UNITE!, bumper sticker ; SOLIDARITY, Local 23-25 UNITE! (convention fans) [4]
Award/Plaque -- NYC Apala Chapter honors May Yin Chin (sp) on your election as 1st Woman Bus. Manager to N.Y. Metropolitan Area Joint Board 9"x12" 2004
Poem -- "The Union Representative" (May the good Lord grant him strength)
Award/Plaque -- Community Appreciation Award presented to UNITE!, 1996, Chinese-American Planning Council, Inc.. 9"x12" 1996
Award/Plaque -- 1999 Community Appreciation Award presented to UNITE! In recognition of your outstanding contribution -- 8"x10" -- 1999
Award/Plaque -- Community Partnership Award, 2004, presented to Local 23-25 Unite -- 8"x10" -- 2004
Award/Plaque -- Community Appreciation Award presented to UNITE! In recognition of your outstanding contribution -- 8"x10" -- 1997
Award/Plaque -- In recognition of International Women's Day and Women's History Month, the Chinese Chapter of CLUW. 9"x12" -- 2004
Award/Plaque -- The Chinese-American Planning Council, Inc. presents the 2002 Community Appreciation Award to UNITE! 6"x8" Marble and wood -- 2002
Award -- 7th Fannie Lou Hamer Award is conferred upon May Ying Chen -- 8.5"x11" 1991
Push pin/buttons -- One Hundred Years Local 10, 2002 [4] -- 2002
book/Autograph(?) -- Red book with Chinese figures in gold on the cover, the inside has signatures written on the pages
Award -- Our salute to United Local 23-25 for the partnership in service and ministry to the Chinatown Community -- 8.5"x11"
Award/Plaque -- Shaped like New York State -- Presented to May Ying Chen, May 21, 1997, In recognition of her outstanding contributions on behalf of the Ethnic Labor 1997
Award/Plaque -- Hispanic Labor Committee, New York City Central Labor Council, AFL-CIO, Presented to May Ying Chen -- 11.5"x14.5"
Award/Plaque -- Metro New York, Labor Communications Council, First Award, Presented to UNITE 23-25 News -- 11.5"x14.5"
Award/Plaque -- Metro New York, Labor Communications Council, First Award, Presented to UNITE VOICE -- 11.5" x14"
Award/Plaque -- Gouverneur Healthcare Services Special Recognition Award Presented to Local 23-25 -- 10.5"x13"
"NOT 1(cent) For Sweatshops Keep Postal Uniforms Sweat-Free" ---- Stamps
Award -- (Plastic 'shooting star' award)- CLUW - May Chen Executive Director, Local 23-25 UNITE-Formally ILGWU, November 11, 1995
Award -- Every Kid Deserves a Y -- In appreciation to Unite Local 23-25 Bronze Sponsor, Chinatown YMCA, 25th Anniversary Dinner, 1999
Paper weight -- Friend of Felix W. Ortiz Award to May Chen, 6/18/98
Rubber stamps -- Some stamps have wooden handles with organizations names and others are date stamps [22]
Rubber stamps (list) Do Not Bend ; Nebraska Service Center ; U.S. Department of Justice Immigration and Naturalization Service ; Copy ; Draft
Rubber stamps (list) US Immig. & Natz. Service ; Immigration and Naturalization Service ; National Visa Center ; Priority Mail ; Received ; date stamp

Rubber stamps (list) Yat Ding Ho Restaurant ; Immigration and Naturalization Service, Texas Service Center ; UNITE Immigration Project ; US Department of Justice, Immigration and Naturalization Service ; Personal
Rubber stamps (list) US Immig. & Natz. Service ; Original Please Return ; Train 7 to Shea Stadium
Banner Nylon 33"x90" -- "Local 62-32 UNITE!" [Red and White letters on Blue nylon, scalloped bottom with fringe]
Banner burlap 3'x113" -- "Don't Buy GUESS! GUESS USES SWEATSHOPS" [burlap with Black, Blue, Red painted lettering]
Banner cotton sheet 3'6"x12'4" -- "ASIAN LABOR COMMITTEE ; NYC Central Labor Council AFL-CIO" [White cotton sheet, Red, Blue painted letters, Chinese characters]
Banner vinyl 3'6"x12'4" -- "UNITE! SPRING HEALTH CONFERENCE" [Red vinyl with White vinyl/adhesive lettering, also Chinese characters]

Banner cotton 5'6"x12' -- "Textbook Scholarship Awards Ceremony ; UNITE HERE! ; NY METRO AREA JT. BD., Textbook Scholarship Program" [some Chinese characters and Spanish on bottom of banner ; White cotton with Blue nylon around the outside, stenciled
Banner vinyl 2'8"x18'7" -- "Protect Garment Workers Rights" [Chinese characters and Spanish ; Red vinyl with White vinyl/adhesive lettering]

Banner cotton sheet 4'x20' -- ASIA LABOR FESTIVAL" [White cotton sheet with Red and Blue tape for lettering, Chinese characters along bottom ; lettering stapled to material, most lettering falling off banner]
Banner vinyl 2'8"x18'7" -- "STOP SWEATSHOPS" [Red vinyl with White vinyl/adhesive lettering, also Chinese characters and Spanish]
Banner vinyl 2'9"x11'8" -- "Garment Industry Day Care Center of Chinatown ; Annual Fund Raising Dinner" [White vinyl with Red vinyl/adhesive lettering]

Broadside 18" dia. -- Round, "UNITE HERE!" [White with Black and Red letters] ; Broadside 18"x24" -- "Not 1{cent} for SWEATSHOPS, KEEP POSTAL UNIFORMS SWEAT-FREE ; UNITE!" [White with Red lettering] ; Broadside 17"x24" -- "Who made your shoes?" [Pi

Award 12"x16" -- 1999 Distinguished Services Award to May Ying Chen ; Broadside 16"x20" -- Picture with wording "Bridge Builder" and below it has "The New York Civic Participation Project ; 2005 Bridge Builder Award ; Presented to: May Y. Chen" ;

scopecontent.p: Broadside 13"x17" -- Thank You, City of Hope [article on Edgar O. Romney]

did.unittitle: Proclamation 14x24 -- "The Council, City of New York ProclamationLocal 23-25 UNITE" 2004
Assorted banners and flags

scopecontent.p: 2 red vinyl flags - [UNITE! And ENFORCE LABOR LAWS] -Chinese on one side and English on one side ; Banner - White cotton, Letters stenciled w/black and blue paint - [WIPEOUT SWEATSHOPS ; UNITE! AFL-CIO] - 96x134 ; White cotton, Letters stenciled w/black and blue paint - [WIPEOUT SWEATSHOPS ; UNITE! AFL-CIO] - 42x96 ; Banner - light blue cloth - [UNITE! GARMENT WORKERS'] - Chinese characters, Letters stenciled with paint (very dirty) - 28x100

did.unittitle: Banners - see list below

scopecontent.p: Light blue cotton "UNITE! GARMENT WORKERS' CENTER" Chinese characters, letters are stenciled with paint 28"x100" (very dirty) ; White cotton "WIPE OUT SWEATSHOPS UNITE! AFL-CIO" letters stenciled with black paint 42"x96" ; White cotton "WIPE OUT SWEATSHOPS UNITE! AFL-CIO" letters stenciled with black paint 42"x134" ; red vinyl Triangle shaped white lettering [2] one flag "Enforce Labor Laws" ; one flag "UNITE" both flags have Chinese characters on flip side
